author: tlsalex
body:
I want to convert disk from Basic to Dynamic using native cmdlet, but seems there is no that kind of cmdlet.
I tried to convert disk from ssd to hdd , but fail as bellow , and I also do not how to change the "canpool" property as I can not find a cmdlet can do that ,  any advise ?
![hdd-type](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36788337/50501212-6f93be80-0a91-11e9-9ffe-f3b128f37d22.png)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @tlsalex Please fill in issue template (what version do you use?).  The repository is only for PowerShell Core. The cmdlet is not in the repo. Please report the issue with Windows 10 Feedback tool or discuss on forums.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: That cmdlet is not one owned by the PowerShell team.  As @iSazonov suggested, please use the Windows 10 Feedback tool.

comments.author: tlsalex
comments.body:
Hello , could you please tell me where I can make feedback to windows 10 powershell team, send me a link if you know.

BR

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Press Start button, type "Feedback", click "Feedback Hub" - use the application to send a feedback to MSFT.

title: manipulate disk using native cmdlet
